item.title: DEAD HEAT...
item.description:
www.reuters.com
Canada's election is in a dead heat two days before the Sept. 20 vote, according to a new poll on Saturday, as Prime Minister Justin Trudeau and his Conservative rival both campaigned in the same seat-rich region to scour up votes.

item.title: USA ramps up plan to expel Haitian migrants gathered in Texas...
item.description:
apnews.com
DEL RIO, Texas (AP) — U.S. officials said Saturday that within the next three days, they plan to ramp up expulsion flights for some of the thousands of Haitian migrants who have gathered in a Texas city from across the border in Mexico.

item.title: In escalation over sub deal, France recalls envoys from USA, Australia...
item.description:
www.reuters.com
France plunged into an unprecedented diplomatic crisis with the United States and Australia on Friday after it recalled its ambassadors from both countries over a trilateral security deal which sank a French-designed submarine contract with Canberra.

news.yahoo.com

item.title: UPDATE: USA to expel migrants from border, fly to Haiti...
item.description:
apnews.com
DEL RIO, Texas (AP) — The Biden administration plans the widescale expulsion of Haitian migrants from a small Texas border city by putting them on flights to Haiti starting Sunday, an official said Friday, representing a swift and dramatic response to thousands who suddenly crossed the border from Mexico and gathered under and around a bridge.

item.title: Turning Trump's CFO Won't Be Easy for New York Prosecutors...
item.description:
www.bloomberg.com
Getting Donald Trump’s longtime chief financial officer to turn on his boss may prove tough, as Allen Weisselberg’s unlikely to get a lengthy sentence even if convicted on tax fraud and other charges.

item.title: Americans Haven't Been This Down on Housing Market Since 1982!
item.description:
finance.yahoo.com
(Bloomberg) -- The last time Americans were this turned off by the U.S. housing market, borrowing costs were over five times the current rate. The share of people who think now is a good time to buy a home fell in September to 29%, extending the plunge from March when the proportion was more than twice as high, data from the University of Michigan consumer sentiment survey showed Friday. It’s also the smallest chunk of respondents since 1982.Back then, the average for a 30-year fixed rate mortga
